title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: Search download data Swiss Federal Statistical Office BFS package allows search download public data Swiss Federal Statistical Office (BFS stands Bundesamt für Statistik German) API dynamic reproducible way.

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: can also install development version Github.

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: Retrieve list publicly available datasets data catalog language (“de”, “fr”, “” “en”) calling bfs_get_catalog_data(). English Italian data catalogs offer limited list datasets. full list please get French (“fr”) German (“de”) data catalogs.
code: catalog_data_en <- bfs_get_catalog_data(language = "en")  catalog_data_en ## # A tibble: 180 × 7 ##    title   language publication_date    url_bfs url_px guid  catalog_date        ##    <chr>   <chr>    <dttm>              <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <dttm>              ##  1 Provis… en       2023-04-04 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  2 Perman… en       2022-10-06 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  3 Privat… en       2022-10-06 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  4 Deaths… en       2022-09-26 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  5 Divorc… en       2022-09-26 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  6 Live b… en       2022-09-26 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  7 Marria… en       2022-09-26 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  8 Acquis… en       2022-08-25 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ##  9 Acquis… en       2022-08-25 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ## 10 Demogr… en       2022-08-25 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-04-04 08:30:00 ## # ℹ 170 more rows

what: Download a dataset in any language
title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: function bfs_get_data() allows download dataset data catalog. download specific dataset, can either use url_bfs number_bfs. url_bfs argument refers offical webpage dataset. Find example getting url_bfs specific dataset using R package “dplyr”. can download full dataset using url_bfs. recommended privilege use number_bfs argument stability reproducibility. can manually find number_bfs opening official webpage looking “FSO number”, showed .   can download dataset using number_bfs. can also access additional information dataset running bfs_get_data_comments().
code: library(dplyr)  url_bfs_uni_students <- catalog_data_en |>   dplyr::filter(title == "University students by year, ISCED field, sex and level of study") |>   dplyr::pull(url_bfs)  url_bfs_uni_students ## [1] "https://www.bfs.admin.ch/content/bfs/en/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/daten.assetdetail.24367729.html" # https://www.bfs.admin.ch/content/bfs/en/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/daten.assetdetail.16324907.html df_uni <- bfs_get_data(url_bfs = url_bfs_uni_students, language = "en") ##   Downloading large query (in 4 batches): ##   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |==================                                                    |  25%  |                                                                              |===================================                                   |  50%  |                                                                              |====================================================                  |  75%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100% df_uni ## # A tibble: 18,060 × 5 ##    Year    `ISCED Field`     Sex    `Level of study`       `University students` ##    <chr>   <chr>             <chr>  <chr>                                  <dbl> ##  1 1980/81 Education science Male   First university degr…                   545 ##  2 1980/81 Education science Male   Bachelor                                   0 ##  3 1980/81 Education science Male   Master                                     0 ##  4 1980/81 Education science Male   Doctorate                                 93 ##  5 1980/81 Education science Male   Further education, ad…                    13 ##  6 1980/81 Education science Female First university degr…                   946 ##  7 1980/81 Education science Female Bachelor                                   0 ##  8 1980/81 Education science Female Master                                     0 ##  9 1980/81 Education science Female Doctorate                                 70 ## 10 1980/81 Education science Female Further education, ad…                    52 ## # ℹ 18,050 more rows # open Uni students dataset webpage browseURL(url_bfs_uni_students) bfs_get_data(number_bfs = "px-x-1502040100_131", language = "en") bfs_get_data_comments(number_bfs = "px-x-1502040100_131", language = "en") ##   Downloading large query (in 4 batches): ##   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |==================                                                    |  25%  |                                                                              |===================================                                   |  50%  |                                                                              |====================================================                  |  75%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100%  ## # A tibble: 1 × 4 ##   row_no col_no comment_type   comment                                           ##    <int>  <int> <chr>          <chr>                                             ## 1     NA      4 column_comment "To ensure that the presentations from cubes con…

previous_headings: Usage > Download a dataset in any language
title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: may get error message query large. may also error API calls many requests. One solution query specific elements dataset download less data. example. First want get variable names, .e. code, categories, .e. values, dataset. can manually select dimensions dataset want query.
code: Error:  Too large query.  The smallest batch size is 24030 and the maximum number of values  that can be downloaded through the API is 5000. Error in pxweb_advanced_get(url = url, query = query, verbose = verbose) :    Too Many Requests (RFC 6585) (HTTP 429). # choose a BFS number and language metadata <- bfs_get_metadata(number_bfs = "px-x-1502040100_131", language = "en")  str(metadata) ## tibble [4 × 7] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) ##  $ code       : chr [1:4] "Jahr" "ISCED Fach" "Geschlecht" "Studienstufe" ##  $ text       : chr [1:4] "Year" "ISCED Field" "Sex" "Level of study" ##  $ values     :List of 4 ##   ..$ : chr [1:43] "0" "1" "2" "3" ... ##   ..$ : chr [1:42] "0" "1" "2" "3" ... ##   ..$ : chr [1:2] "0" "1" ##   ..$ : chr [1:5] "0" "1" "2" "3" ... ##  $ valueTexts :List of 4 ##   ..$ : chr [1:43] "1980/81" "1981/82" "1982/83" "1983/84" ... ##   ..$ : chr [1:42] "Education science" "Teacher training without subject specialisation" "Teacher training with subject specialisation" "Fine arts" ... ##   ..$ : chr [1:2] "Male" "Female" ##   ..$ : chr [1:5] "First university degree or diploma" "Bachelor" "Master" "Doctorate" ... ##  $ time       : logi [1:4] TRUE NA NA NA ##  $ elimination: logi [1:4] NA TRUE TRUE TRUE ##  $ title      : chr [1:4] "University students by Year, ISCED Field, Sex and Level of study" "University students by Year, ISCED Field, Sex and Level of study" "University students by Year, ISCED Field, Sex and Level of study" "University students by Year, ISCED Field, Sex and Level of study" # Manually create BFS query dimensions # Use `code` and `values` elements # Use "*" to select all dimensions <- list(   "Jahr" = c("40", "41"),   "ISCED Fach" = c("0"),   "Geschlecht" = c("*"),   "Studienstufe" = c("2", "3"))  # Query BFS data with specific dimensions BFS::bfs_get_data(   number_bfs = "px-x-1502040100_131",   language = "en",   query = dimensions   ) ## # A tibble: 8 × 5 ##   Year    `ISCED Field`     Sex    `Level of study` `University students` ##   <chr>   <chr>             <chr>  <chr>                            <dbl> ## 1 2020/21 Education science Male   Master                             151 ## 2 2020/21 Education science Male   Doctorate                          121 ## 3 2020/21 Education science Female Master                             555 ## 4 2020/21 Education science Female Doctorate                          306 ## 5 2021/22 Education science Male   Master                             143 ## 6 2021/22 Education science Male   Doctorate                          115 ## 7 2021/22 Education science Female Master                             599 ## 8 2021/22 Education science Female Doctorate                          318

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: lot tables accessible official API, still present official BFS website. can search specific tables using bfs_get_catalog_tables(). BFS tables Excel CSV files. example, can use “openxlsx” R package read specific Excel table using url_table column.
code: catalog_tables_en_students <- bfs_get_catalog_tables(language = "en", title = "students")  catalog_tables_en_students ## # A tibble: 5 × 7 ##   title language publication_date    url_bfs url_table guid  catalog_date        ##   <chr> <chr>    <dttm>              <chr>   <chr>     <chr> <dttm>              ## 1 Stud… en       2023-04-05 00:00:00 https:… https://… bfsR… 2023-04-05 00:00:00 ## 2 Stud… en       2023-04-05 00:00:00 https:… https://… bfsR… 2023-04-05 00:00:00 ## 3 Stud… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https://… bfsR… 2023-04-05 00:00:00 ## 4 Stud… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https://… bfsR… 2023-04-05 00:00:00 ## 5 Stud… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https://… bfsR… 2023-04-05 00:00:00 library(dplyr) library(openxlsx)  tables_bfs_uni_students <- catalog_tables_en_students |>   dplyr::slice(3) |>   dplyr::pull(url_table)  df_table <- tryCatch(expr = openxlsx::read.xlsx(tables_bfs_uni_students, startRow = 1),     error = function(e) "Failed reading table") |>   dplyr::as_tibble()  df_table ## # A tibble: 6 × 2 ##   Students.at.Universities.and.Institutes.of.Technology.(UIT).2022/23:.S…¹ X2    ##   <chr>                                                                    <chr> ## 1 "Definitions "                                                           Defi… ## 2 "Tab 1"                                                                  Entr… ## 3 "Tab 2"                                                                  Stud… ## 4 "Tab 3"                                                                  Stud… ## 5 "Tab 4"                                                                  Stud… ## 6 "Tab 5"                                                                  Fore… ## # ℹ abbreviated name: ## #   ¹​`Students.at.Universities.and.Institutes.of.Technology.(UIT).2022/23:.Standard.Tables`

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: hood, package using pxweb package query Swiss Federal Statistical Office PXWEB API. PXWEB API structure developed Statistics Sweden national statistical institutions (NSI) disseminate public statistics structured way. can clean column names datasets automatically using janitor::clean_names() adding argument clean_names = TRUE bfs_get_data() function.

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office
text: package way officially related endorsed Swiss Federal Statistical Office (BFS).

title: Get Data from the Swiss Statistical Office

what: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
title: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
text: Get list data available official RSS Feed Swiss Federal Statistical Office data catalog.

title: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
code: bfs_get_catalog_data(   language = "de",   title = NULL,   spatial_division = NULL,   prodima = NULL,   inquiry = NULL,   institution = NULL,   publishing_year_start = NULL,   publishing_year_end = NULL,   order_nr = NULL,   skip_limit = TRUE )

title: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
text: language character language BFS catalog, .e. "de", "fr", "" "en". title character String search title, subtitle supertitle spatial_division BFS datasets spatial division, choose "Switzerland", "Cantons", "Districts", "Communes", "spatial divisions" "International" prodima numeric Get specific BFS themes using one multiple prodima numbers inquiry character BFS datasets inquiry institution character BFS datasets institution publishing_year_start character BFS datasets publishing year start publishing_year_end character BFS datasets publishing year end order_nr character Filter BFS Number (FSO number) skip_limit boolean skip limit, TRUE FALSE

title: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
text: data frame tbl_df (type data frame; see tibble dplyr packages). title character column title BFS dataset language character column language BFS dataset publication_date published date BFS dataset data catalog url_bfs character column URL related BFS    webpage url_px character column URL PX file guid Globally Unique Identifier item RSS document catalog_date released date current BFS data catalog

title: Get the BFS data catalog — bfs_get_catalog_data
code: bfs_get_catalog_data(language = "en", title = "students", prodima = c(900212)) #> GET request successful. Parsing... #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   title    language publication_date    url_bfs url_px guid  catalog_date        #>   <chr>    <chr>    <dttm>              <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <dttm>              #> 1 Univers… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-03-28 08:30:00 #> 2 Univers… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-03-28 08:30:00 #> 3 Univers… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-03-28 08:30:00 #> 4 Univers… en       2023-03-28 08:30:00 https:… https… bfsR… 2023-03-28 08:30:00

what: Download BFS data in a given language — bfs_get_data
title: Download BFS data in a given language — bfs_get_data
text: Download dataset using BFS offical API v1. choose either bfs number bfs offical url given dataset. can query particulary variables using `query` argument.

title: Download BFS data in a given language — bfs_get_data
code: bfs_get_data(   number_bfs = NULL,   language = "de",   url_bfs = NULL,   query = NULL,   column_name_type = "text",   variable_value_type = "text",   clean_names = FALSE )

title: Download BFS data in a given language — bfs_get_data
text: number_bfs BFS number dataset. language Language dataset translated exists, .e. "de", "fr", "" "en". url_bfs URL page dataset. query list named values, json query file json query string using pxweb::pxweb_query(). column_name_type Column name type "text" "code". variable_value_type Variable value type "text" "code". clean_names Clean column names using janitor::clean_names().

title: Download BFS data in a given language — bfs_get_data
text: tbl_df (type data frame; see tibble dplyr packages).

title: Get the comments/footnotes of a BFS dataset in a given language — bfs_get_data_comments

title: BFS 0.4.8
text: BREAKING CHANGE: reorder arguments functions consistency bfs_get_catalog_tables() now gets full catalog, fixing #5 bfs_get_catalog_tables() new functions filter datasets directly use “httr2” instead “jsonlite” better console messages improve README, docs sticker.

title: BFS 0.4.7
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-19 add new function bfs_get_metadata() fix bug duplicated column names as_tibble(. .name_repair = "minimal")

title: BFS 0.4.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-27 Fix bug bfs_get_data_comments() #8. improve README adding info dependencies.

title: BFS 0.4.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-12-14 Fix bug using query argument bfs_get_data() remove depreciated function bfs_get_metadata() bfs_get_dataset()

title: BFS 0.4.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-07 Fixed bfs_get_catalog_data() bfs_get_catalog_tables() bug #6. tidyRSS GitHub dependency version 2.0.5. Add tests bfs_get_catalog_* functions.

title: BFS 0.4.2
text: Fixed bfs_get_catalog_data() bfs_get_catalog_tables() bug #6. tidyRSS dependency version 2.0.4. Improved README.

title: BFS 0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-09 BREAKING CHANGE: clean_names bfs_get_data() now FALSE default. bfs_get_data() uses BFS API v1. bfs_get_metadata() deprecated. Please use bfs_get_catalog_data(). add bfs_get_catalog_tables(). add bfs_get_catalog(). pxweb jsonlite dependency added. dplyr dependency removed.

title: BFS 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-10 fix issue #3 pull request #1

title: BFS 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-23 fix critical bug bfs_get_dataset() add new function bfs_get_catalog()

title: BFS 0.2.6
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added bfs_get_catalog() function, scraps RSS feed
